description: You should increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead when you:

choices.description: Are following a small passenger vehicle.
Are being tailgated by another driver.
Are driving more slowly than the posted speed limit.
All of the Above

description: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead?

choices.description: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.
When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.
When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.

description: If a truck or bus is making a right turn where you also need to make a right turn, you should:

choices.description: Wait until the truck or bus turns before you turn.
Quickly turn before the truck or bus is able to.
Squeeze between the truck or bus and the curb.

description: When being followed by a tailgater, which of the following will help you avoid being hit from behind?

choices.description: Merging into another lane
Changing lanes frequently
Decreasing your following distance
A and C

description: When driving under snowy or icy conditions:

choices.description: It is safe to use your cruise control.
Make speed and directional changes more gradually than you would otherwise.
Drive as you would under normal conditions.

description: A broken yellow centerline means that:

choices.description: Passing is not permitted.
Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.

description: When driving in fog, rain, or snow, use:

choices.description: Low beams.
High beams.
Fog lights only.

description: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

choices.description: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.
Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots.

description: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) that is ___ or higher...
You must notify the DMV within 5 days if...

choices.description: Sell or transfer your vehicle
Are cited for traffic violation
Paint your vehicle a different color

description: At dawn or dusk, or in rain or snow, it can be hard to see and be seen. A good way to let other drivers know you are there is to turn...

choices.description: Up the instrument panel lights
On your parking lights
On your headlights

description: When changing lanes on a freeway, you should...

choices.description: Signal for at least 5 seconds
Slow down before you start to change lanes
Assume there is enough space for your vehicle, if you signal first

description: You are driving in a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What do you do?

choices.description: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down
Drive to the right edge of the road and stop
Stay in you lane, slow down, and let it pass
All of the above

description: Large trucks turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction...

choices.description: May complete their turn in either the left or right lane
Often have to use part of the left lane to complete the turn
Must stay in the right lane at all times

description: You are driving on a one-way street. You may turn left onto another one-way street:

choices.description: Only if a sign permits the turn
If traffic on the street is moving to the left
If traffic on the street is moving to the right

description: You want to pass a bicyclist riding on the edge of your lane, You:

choices.description: Must not squeeze past the bicyclist
Must Honk your horn before passing the bicyclist
Must not pass the bicyclist for any reason

description: You should not start across an intersection if you know you will block the intersection when the light turns red:

choices.description: Under any circumstances
Unless you entered the intersection on a yellow light
Unless you entered the intersection on a green light

description: When making a right turn, look right and left, yield right-of-way, and turn the steering wheel using:

choices.description: Hand off hand technique
A double hand technique
Single hand technique
Hand over hand technique

description: If you approach an intersection at which the traffic lights are not working, you must first _______ for entering the intersection and yield the right of way.

choices.description: Turn on emergency lights
Reduce your speed
Come to a complete stop
Increase your speed

description: Must not pass another vehicle if you see:

choices.description: An approaching hill or curve where there is no clear visibility
Schoolbus ahead with red flashing lights and an extended
A solid yellow line in your lane
Any of the above situations
